item.title: Hyperbeat has completed a $5.2 million seed round, with ether.fi Ventures and Electric Capital co-leading the investment.
item.description: On August 15th, as per CoinDesk, within the Hyperliquid ecosystem's native yield layer, Hyperbeat completed a $5.2 million oversubscribed seed round of financing. Ether.fi Ventures and Electric Capital took the lead in this. Other participants encompassed Coinbase Ventures, Chapter One, Selini, Maelstrom, Anchorage Digital, and supporters from the HyperCollective community.It is reported that Hyperbeat intends to construct permissionless financial infrastructure, enabling anyone to earn yield, stake, and conduct transactions directly from their on-chain portfolios.

item.title: A new address withdrew $10.2 million in LINK from Binance.
item.description: August 15th. As per the monitoring by LookOnChain, a newly established wallet address has withdrawn 455,298 LINK from Binance within the past 4 hours (approximately $10.2 million).

item.title: Binance Wallet will launch the OpenEden Booster event, with an Alpha Point threshold of 61 points.
item.description: August 15th. According to official channels, Binance Wallet is set to launch the OpenEden Booster event. Users whose Alpha points are greater than or equal to 61 are eligible to participate in this event. The event will commence on August 18th at 19:00 (UTC+8), and the total reward offered is 20,000,000 EDEN coins.

item.title: SEC Chair: Mobilizing All Departments to Make the U.S. a Global Cryptocurrency Center
item.description: August 15: Paul Atkins, who is the Chairman of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), declared that he is mobilizing all departments to transform the United States into a global center for Bitcoin and cryptocurrency.

item.title: DeFi Development Allocates Around $22 Million to Purchase an Additional 110,000 SOL Tokens
item.description: On August 15th, as per globenewswire, DeFi Development Corp. (Nasdaq: DFDV) announced today that it presently holds around 1,420,173 SOL and SOL-equivalent assets on its balance sheet. This encompasses the rewards obtained through staking and on-chain activities.This growth was fuelled by the company's acquisition of 110,000 SOL at an average price of $201.68, with a total worth of approximately $22 million.

item.title: Foreign Media: If the US Government Forces Google to Sell Chrome, OpenAI Founder is Interested in Acquiring
item.description: On August 15th, as reported by The Verge, if the U.S. government compels Google to sell Chrome, Sam Altman, the founder of OpenAI, shows interest in acquiring it. OpenAI intends to fund a competitor to Neuralink, a brain-machine interface company.

item.title: Traders Trim Bets on Fed Rate Cut, Still Expect Cut in September
item.description: August 15: Traders reduced their wagers on a Fed rate cut; however, they still anticipate a rate cut in September and another one in 2025. (FX Street)

item.title: Fed's Mester: Latest PPI, CPI Inflation Data Cause for Concern
item.description: On August 15th, the Fed's Gullspie stated that the recent PPI and CPI inflation data are of concern. (Xinhua Finance)

item.title: U.S. Retail Sales MoM July 0.5%, Expected 0.5%
item.description: On August 15th, in the US, July Retail Sales Month-on-Month was 0.5%, which was in line with the expected 0.5%. (Xinhua)

item.title: Barclays: Powell's Hawkish Stance Will Not be Changed by Jobs Data
item.description: On Friday, Barclays Bank stated that although the market anticipates a Fed rate cut in September, the recent US employment data is unlikely to influence Fed Chair Jerome Powell's cautious attitude towards interest rates. The bank expects only a 25-basis-point cut in December this year and believes that investors are overly optimistic about a September rate cut, misinterpreting the Fed's perspective on the strength of the labor market.Powell recently indicated that monetary policy is "only moderately restrictive" and the labor market is "robust." Even with the deceleration in July job growth and a 4.2% unemployment rate, Barclays has not detected any indications of a change in stance from hawkish Fed officials. The decision on a September rate cut remains uncertain, and the bank will pay attention to speeches at the Jackson Hole conference for clues.
